natural solution: Since these equations look symmetric, at least on the left-hand side, we add all three together. This gives us  \begin{align} &a(x+1+y)+b(y+x+1)+c(1+y+x)\\ &\qquad\qquad=x+7+2x+6y+4x+y. \end{align} We then factor out $(1+x+y)$ on the left and simplify the right side to get \begin{align}
(1+x+y)(a+b+c)&=7x+7y+7, \text{ so}\\ (1+x+y)(a+b+c)&=7(1+x+y). \end{align} Since $x+y\neq -1$, we know $x+y+1\neq 0$, so we can divide both sides by that term and find that $a+b+c=\boxed{7}$.
